website_summaries.verdict: The WD My Book Thunderbolt Duo makes a very good external storage device for Thunderbolt-enabled Macs thanks to its comparative affordability, ease of use, and decent performance.
pros: The WD My Book Thunderbolt Duo makes a great alternative to USB- or FireWire-based external drives
The drive is relatively affordable, supports RAID configurations, and is easy to service
cons: The WD My Book Thunderbolt Duo's performance is comparatively slow
The drive doesn't offer any other connection types, nor does it include a Thunderbolt cable

customer_reviews.title: Excellent drive
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for 4 months and it has worked perfectly since I set this up on my Macbook Pro. I am using it in a Mirrored configuration and have two other thunderbolt external Hard Disk(s), I also own the Seagate thunderbolt adapter and a Seagate external 2tb Hard disk running in a raid setup with it, and finally I have a Lacie 1TB Raid thunderbolt drive. The Western Digital My Book Thunderbolt external is fast, works perfectly, uses their green 3.5in HDs. Anyone of these drives can backup (clone) my Macbook Pro's internal drive in 2min or less .
customer_reviews.author: dwarf

customer_reviews.title: A Great RAID Option For Video Editing
customer_reviews.text: I use this as my primary drive for video editing. I love the speed and dependability. The fact that it's Thunderbolt enabled allows me to keep my two USB ports free. My biggest complaint is that there is no on/off switch. This means whenever I want to turn the drive off I need to put my computer to sleep, wait for the LED light to turn off, disconnect the power or Thunderbolt cable, then wake my computer. This process gets tiresome.
customer_reviews.author: Kephen

customer_reviews.title: Awesome external storage!
customer_reviews.text: This is great external storage. Plug and play. Can be configured in multiple ways (separate drives, mirrored). I use it to hold backups of my most important stuff - movies, pictures and music :-) Highly recommend it - it's really fast. I have three macs, and they all have sharing turned on. I can access this drive from any of the computers and it works really well. Lots of storage, fast.
customer_reviews.author: TexasGirl

customer_reviews.title: Perfect large RAID array
customer_reviews.text: Perfect large RAID array, normal users may not need this drive but I do allot of editing on my Mac and this in raid 0 offers very fast access to my files externally, although I do recommend you set OSX to power off disks when not in use as this does get very hot if left on for a long period. I'd also keep it in a rather free and open area were it can breath, I keep it behind my monitors and have plenty of room for it to cool off.
customer_reviews.author: CotyM

customer_reviews.title: Wow, that's a lot of space.
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this with my 2012 mac mini and in the 6TB mode (non-raid). Very fast, no issues with anything from setup to usage. Note that doing massive transfers does impact the CPU a bit (I'm assuming that thunderbolt has more overhead then firewire or the sata drives. I'm probably going to reformat to 3T so that I have some sort of fail safe (remember: raid is not a backup technology).
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Great when it wakes up
customer_reviews.text: To save power the drive goes into an energy saver mode. I would have liked an option to define the energy saver levels and have one option that wakes the drive up when I begin to use my Mac. As it is, when I do make a call to the drive I need to wait for it to rev up. Once it is active the speed is by far the best of any external drives I have used.
customer_reviews.author: Tripleplay

customer_reviews.title: With the Thunderbolt connection this unit works as fast as ...
customer_reviews.text: With the Thunderbolt connection this unit works as fast as the internal drive. I moved all my movies and photos to this device. Forget USB and Firewire connections. I use them as well but they don't hold a candle to Thunderbolt. Pricey but well worth it if you have a need for speed
customer_reviews.author: Roper Davis

customer_reviews.title: Windows?  Not so much...
customer_reviews.text: Although billed as "ideal for running Windows OS on a Mac," this drive is listed by the manufacturer as "not supported" for Windows--as I learned after wasting half a day trying to get Windows 7 (running on a Mac Mini) to recognize it. So I guess I'll have to ship it back tomorrow.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Ferris

customer_reviews.title: Great drive
customer_reviews.text: I am many years into using this drive. They have held up well for my use and that is pretty much a constant thing. The speed is also pretty good for the age and speed of the drives. The drive set definitely sold me on thunderbolt
customer_reviews.author: stephen

customer_reviews.title: Works just great!!  Easy to Set Up
customer_reviews.text: Very good external drive. Thunderbolt is a nice convenience if your connecting directly (of course even though thunderbolt is fast your drive is limited by the read/write speed of the drive, about 125MB/s which is still fine) If you're connecting via ethernet make sure you have a Gigabit Router so that your network speeds match the disk read/write speeds (1000Mbits/s = 125 MBytes/s) (makes a big difference when you transfer a few hundred gigs of data)
customer_reviews.author: SimonRim

customer_reviews.title: WD gets it right
customer_reviews.text: FInally a sound, reliable and no-nonsense product from WD again, after the multiple issues with virtual CD drives, the 'ebook' labeling and sleep on Mac. This unit - a sizable, but still compact hunk of plastic - works. ANd it works well. It's extremely fast (faster than the 'green' drives inside would lead you to believe), the setup for Raid 1 or 0 is easy and straightforward, and there are no sleep issues. Thunderbolt works very well on this one. As always, cable ends get quite hot, and there is no thunderbolt cable included in the box. Short of that, these are great units.
customer_reviews.author: dosers

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Product is quiet and fast. Works perfectly with time machine and chrono sync simultaneously in JBOD configuration. Recommended for use on mac systems.
customer_reviews.author: burtonBomb

customer_reviews.title: easy to set up with my imac
customer_reviews.text: easy to set up with my imac. nice speed and back up. little big. would like it to be smaller than this size. no issue so far.
customer_reviews.author: deafbuzz

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: I needed a reliable backup and storage option for all of my digital pictures. The My Book was very easy to set up and keeps chugging along.
customer_reviews.author: Sheri L.

customer_reviews.title: VERY FAST!!!!
customer_reviews.text: love this thing. i use it for video editing on my macbook pro and adobe products. i really makes everything fly!!
customer_reviews.author: jr

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I have had no problem with any of my WD drives and this one is no exception.
customer_reviews.author: Hilarita Hogan

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: The drives work great. I bought this because I store a lot of photos in RAW format. I've set it up as mirrored so one drive is a backup. The thunderbolt connection is very fast.
customer_reviews.author: WB

customer_reviews.title: Nice and quiet
customer_reviews.text: Lots of storage with very low noise. I use to backup my 3TB Imac. Easy to install and starts up automatically with backup software.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Skenandore

customer_reviews.title: A GREAT purchase!
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. Fast and plenty of storage place. I will eventually get a second one since I do a lot of video editing.
customer_reviews.author: Tri L

customer_reviews.title: MY Book Thunderbolt Duo 6gb Drive
customer_reviews.text: This is an incredible piece of equipment. It is fast! reliable! and easy to set up! Accessing 300mb image files across our gigabit ethernet network is as fast as if they were on the local machine using them.
customer_reviews.author: TechKnowledgable

customer_reviews.title: Works Great and Fast
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised, I have 2 of these, they are quiet, the occasional hum, and super fast. I got it around 1 month ago for all my media files,
customer_reviews.author: F

customer_reviews.title: Rock-solid product
customer_reviews.text: I've owned a 1TB Western Digital external drive for three years now and it has yet to quit on me. I also have a WD 1TB Passport and no problems yet. Overall I think WD drives are well-made, flexible and performs reliably.
customer_reviews.author: atekjac

customer_reviews.title: great item
customer_reviews.text: this has worked perfectly for 5 years now. great item
customer_reviews.author: Tom Yaz

customer_reviews.title: backup
customer_reviews.text: this sits on my desk as backup. the 2 drives allow mirror imaging. as such i can back up once but have two copies in case one drive fails
customer_reviews.author: Michael brodsky

customer_reviews.title: WD My Book Thunderbolt Dou 6TB Dual-Drive
customer_reviews.text: Thanks Just great. Works fast on my IMac 27 Cor 7 I am using it for editing - FinalCut x Shipment went very well
customer_reviews.author: Shlomo Shoham

customer_reviews.title: Excellent design and quiet
customer_reviews.text: Brushed aluminum look goes well with my new 27" iMac. Large in size but unobtrusive. Highly recommended for large media library storage.
customer_reviews.author: William M Russo

customer_reviews.title: DIDNT WORK
customer_reviews.text: Didnt work the day i got it, called up, complained had to talk to about 5 different people, eventually managed to get details of where to return it to, had to pay $50 for shipping, then received the exact item the same as before with the same problem as when i first got it. Now stuck with it sitting on my shelf with no use, 700 bucks down the drain.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: not working dual drives for retina
customer_reviews.text: i was going to use this for my macbook pro retina. one for back ups and another for time machine. can't split to 2 drives for retina.
customer_reviews.author: minho ha

customer_reviews.title: Needed PC storage - Great Customer Service on Return
customer_reviews.text: Our IT guy steered me to the wrong storage device... this is for MAC, not PC. My IT dude was a little embarrassed when he realized I ordered from his link for my PC storage. He did a Simpson's "Doh" when I read the package to him when it arrived. I'm sure it's a great device as the ratings are high. Western Digital was gracious about the return. We returned it in unopened condition and then finally found the right one for a PC.
customer_reviews.author: Marketing Diva

customer_reviews.title: The jury is still out
customer_reviews.text: After receiving the hard drive I haven't had much of a chance to use it. But after a short trial run I really couldn't see any large significant difference between it and my older model. I will need to check back with you later.
customer_reviews.author: Themarlin

customer_reviews.title: Too much $$ to not include a cable
customer_reviews.text: Seriously.... Just ship the cable with it!! Way too much money to not include a simple cable. I had other thunderbolt cables but of course this one would be different
customer_reviews.author: Misc

customer_reviews.title: Stay away if you have a Mac
customer_reviews.text: Have had this drive now for about six months, running El Capitan. Continuous problems with WD software, problems with permissions, have to enter computer password any time I want to add/delete/move files, problems connecting to the drive, Apple's Disk Utility can't access to repair disk permissions, WD's own software can't access. One problem after another. Hoping updates to WD software and firmware would eventually resolve, as of this writing (March 2016) still no joy. If you have another RAID option, go with it.
customer_reviews.author: subcmdr

customer_reviews.title: A Problem From Day One
customer_reviews.text: The internal drive of the My Book was defective and was unable to download it's own software to my computer and causing a problem with the computer sleep/wake mode not allowing the monitor to come on when the computer was turned on. It inactivated the mouse and the keyboard as well. I Called WD customer service and received no solution. The person I spoke to wasn't aware of the software update. Worked with Apple's Technicians and after many days a Senior technician with 37 years experience went through the entire computer and came back to the My Book. When disconnected the iMac computer works fine. Somewhere someone is missing the boat on quality control before releasing the product for shipment.
customer_reviews.author: Art

customer_reviews.title: Speed demon
customer_reviews.text: This doesn't come with a Thunderbolt cable. And it only works with Thunderbolt.It shows 3.83TB for me, for whatever that is worth. You can set different RAID settings to ensure backup, but you basically cut your storage in half to do so. Uses Caviar Green drives, which are supposed to use less energy and are, I think a key feature, user replaceable. Once you plug it in, it loads up very, very quickly. I'm getting into video editing now and its blazingly fast. It is as big as my Mac Mini.
customer_reviews.author: Shlok Vaidya

customer_reviews.title: Unique....
customer_reviews.text: I had this item for 3 month and it help so much when I editing 4 or 5 video tracks in Final Cut Pro. How different with the USB External Hard Drive ( it so slow... ) I recommended it...
customer_reviews.author: thechrivo

customer_reviews.title: Serious problem
customer_reviews.text: In the first week after buying when used in mirrored mode with a new Mac Book Pro (Retina) it had 2 rebuilds. Each took 18 hours for a 500GB data set. I just got a full replacement. Copied the data over it took only 2 hours (great speed of TB cable). 1 day later degradation and rebuild again!!! This is crazy. Any ideas out there. I will be calling WD again. The first time they suggested just replacing with Amazon ... but there is something seriously wrong with the firmware / software for mirrored mode. So beware.
customer_reviews.author: g.d.b

customer_reviews.title: Thunderbolt Duo 6TB
customer_reviews.text: The drive works as expected. This is the 3rd Western Digital drive I've owned and i have not been disappointed. The only negative is the cost for a Thunderbolt drive which I assume will decrease in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: flawless product!!
customer_reviews.text: product is very fast, lots of storage, and i would recommend it to music producers. this product was also brought because western digital has a great reputation for hardrives.
customer_reviews.author: daj

customer_reviews.title: Western Digital is great to work with
customer_reviews.text: Our IT guys send to order this for our PC... This however is for a MAC/Apple so we had to send it back for a refund. Western was super easy to work with on this.
customer_reviews.author: Chad O'Mealy

customer_reviews.title: quiet and so far reliable, but expensive (cables) and not fast
customer_reviews.text: Overall, have liked this drive for backup. However, though it is quiet, it is very slow and the cables are not included and very expensive. Overall, decent drive and has worked.
customer_reviews.author: A4Q96

customer_reviews.title: ESATA DOA
customer_reviews.text: Drive seemed to work over USB. ESATA was dead. I called WD and they offered to replace the drive but I did not want the hassle if they are shipping defective enclosures. I returned it to Amazon for a refund and will look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

product_meta.title: WD My Book Thunderbolt Duo 6TB External Dual Hard Drive Storage with RAID
product_meta.description:
Size:6 TBFROM THE MANUFACTURER


MY BOOK THUNDERBOLT DUO – DUAL-DRIVE STORAGE SYSTEM. 
My Book Thunderbolt Duo dual-drive storage system delivers the optimum fusion of performance and capacity. This drive offers two Thunderbolt ports delivering the revolutionary data transfer speeds available only with Thunderbolt technology. Daisy chain multiple devices through My Book Thunderbolt Duo and enjoy nearly unlimited flexibility and performance in your creative life.

Revolutionary Thunderbolt technology
Finally, a drive that can keep pace with your creativity. The leading-edge speed of Thunderbolt technology lets creative pros design, edit, render and produce graphics, movies, music and more in record time. User-selectable RAID 0/1 
Customize this dual-drive storage system to your needs – RAID 0 for speed, RAID 1 for data protection, JBOD to use the drives individually.

High-speed multi-tasking
The revolutionary bi-directional Thunderbolt technology delivers unmatched speed for multi-tasking while video editing, 3D rendering and completing other graphics-intensive projects. 
Move data at unprecedented speeds - Video editors and other digital media professionals can do more work in less time with the ground-breaking data transfer speed of the Thunderbolt ports on My Book Thunderbolt Duo. It offers the indisputably fastest way to get information to and from your external drive. Finally, a drive that can keep up with your creativity.

Dual drive RAID storage system - User-selectable RAID or JBOD modes. When set to RAID 0 (striping), My Book Thunderbolt Duo offers the performance you need when designing or editing graphics-intensive media files. When set to RAID1 (mirroring), this drive provides double safe data protection by automatically generating a duplicate copy of your data. Set to JBOD (Just a Bunch Of Disks) to use as two individual drives and select between HFS+J or ExFAT per disk. Ideal for running Windows OS on a Mac.

Dual Thunderbolt ports enhance workflow efficiency - Daisy chain up to seven devices or peripherals using the two Thunderbolt ports to achieve maximum workflow efficiency and productivity.

High-speed multi-tasking - The revolutionary bi-directional Thunderbolt technology delivers unmatched speed for multi-tasking while video editing, 3D rendering and completing other graphics-intensive projects.

User-serviceable - Want to replace a drive? Simply open the case and exchange the existing drive – no tools needed. If you fill up a drive, you can simply remove it and replace it with a fresh drive and begin saving even more of your creative life.

WD Drive Utilities - Register your drive, run diagnostics, manage RAID or JBOD modes and more using WD Drive Utilities.


Thunderbolt Interface
Designed by Intel, Thunderbolt technology is the fastest, most flexible interface ever. Thunderbolt technology offers performance, simplicity and flexibility.

 * Performance - Transfer a full-length HD movie in under 30 seconds. Thunderbolt technology delivers unprecedented data transfer rates with a connector that is capable of providing two bi-directional channels each with up to 10 Gb/s of bandwidth.
 * Simplicity - Reduce the clutter while you increase your productivity. Thunderbolt technology supports daisy chaining multiple devices through a single Thunderbolt cable so you can multi-task at maximum speed without having to switch out devices.
 * Flexibility - Connect Thunderbolt technology-enabled external hard drives, media players, HD displays, media capture and editing systems and more through a single cable and enjoy nearly unlimited flexibility and performance in your creative life.


Ideal for

 * Moving data at the unprecedented speeds of Thunderbolt technology
 * Daisy-chaining multiple devices like HD monitors, video and audio editors, media players and more through the dual Thunderbolt ports for nearly unlimited workflow efficiency and productivity
 * Multi-tasking while video editing, 3D rendering and completing other graphics-intensive projects
 * Enhancing system performance by setting to RAID 0 to boost speed
 * Protecting your data with user-selectable RAID 1 that automatically generates a duplicate copy of your data
 * Setting to JBOD to use the system as two individual drives
 * Selecting ExFat to run Windows OS on a Mac


What's in the box
Dual-drive storage system with Thunderbolt connector, AC adapter, Quick Install Guide.
Thunderbolt cable included with 8 TB model only.

Compatibility
Formatted for Mac OS X Snow Leopard or Lion operating system
Note: Compatibility may vary depending on user's hardware configuration and operating system.

System Requirements
Computer with Thunderbolt connector
Mac OS X 10.6.8 or higher
Thunderbolt cable (must be purchased separately)

Configuration
Configurable for maximum speed (RAID 0), data protection/mirror mode (RAID 1) or use the drives individually in JBOD mode.

Thunderbolt and the Thunderbolt logo are trademarks of Intel Corporation in the U.S. and/or other countries.

Features at a glance

 * Revolutionary Thunderbolt technology
 * User-selectable RAID 0/1
 * High-speed multi-tasking
 * Move data at unprecedented speeds
 * Dual Thunderbolt ports enhance workflow efficiency
 * User-serviceable



For more great WD products, visit the Western Digital Store at Amazon.com



External Storage

PREMIUM STORAGE WITH BACKUP
STORAGE WITH THUNDERBOLT TECHNOLOGY
